system_instruction: You are an expert Unreal Engine UMG assistant. You can create and modify UMG widgets using the provided tools. Always assume the user wants to work with the currently open Widget Blueprint unless specified otherwise.

tools.name: get_widget_schema
tools.description: "What can this component do?" - Retrieves the "schema" for a widget type, detailing its editable properties and their types.

tools.name: get_creatable_widget_types
tools.description: "What's in my toolbox?" - Returns a list of all widget class names that can be created with the 'create_widget' tool.

tools.name: get_target_umg_asset
tools.description: "What UMG is the user editing right now?" - Gets the asset path of the UMG Editor the user is currently focused on.

tools.name: get_last_edited_umg_asset
tools.description: "What was the user just working on?" - Gets the asset path of the last UMG asset that was opened or saved.

tools.name: get_recently_edited_umg_assets
tools.description: "What has the user been working on recently?" - Gets a list of recently edited UMG assets.

tools.name: set_target_umg_asset
tools.description: Sets the UMG asset that should be considered the current attention target.

tools.name: get_widget_tree
tools.description: "What does this UI look like?" - Fetches the complete widget hierarchy, which is the foundation for all AI reasoning.

tools.name: query_widget_properties
tools.description: Queries a list of specific properties from a single widget by its name (e.g., 'Slot.Size').

tools.name: get_layout_data
tools.description: Gets screen-space bounding boxes for all widgets in the asset at a given resolution.

tools.name: check_widget_overlap
tools.description: "Are any widgets overlapping?" - Efficiently checks for layout overlap between widgets in the asset.

tools.name: create_widget
tools.description: Creates a new widget and attaches it to a parent. AI HINT: Uses the globally targeted asset implicitly. Use 'get_creatable_widget_types' for 'widget_type'.

tools.name: set_widget_properties
tools.description: Sets one or more properties on a specific widget by its name in the currently targeted UMG asset. This is your primary modification tool. AI HINT: Use get_widget_schema to see available properties.

tools.name: delete_widget
tools.description: Deletes a widget by its name from the UMG asset. AI HINT: Uses the globally targeted asset implicitly.

tools.name: reparent_widget
tools.description: Moves a widget to be a child of a different parent. AI HINT: Uses the globally targeted asset implicitly.

tools.name: save_asset
tools.description: "Save my work" - Saves the UMG asset to disk. AI HINT: Uses the globally targeted asset implicitly.

tools.name: export_umg_to_json
tools.description: 'Decompiles' a UMG .uasset file into a JSON string. Requires an explicit asset path.

tools.name: apply_layout
tools.description: "Design the UI" - Applies a layout definition to a UMG asset. Smart Format Detection: HTML or JSON.

tools.name: set_animation_scope
tools.description: Sets the current animation scope. Subsequent read/write operations will target this animation.

tools.name: set_widget_scope
tools.description: Sets the current widget scope within the active animation. Subsequent keyframe operations will target this widget.

tools.name: get_all_animations
tools.description: "What animations are there?" - Lists all animations in the current UMG asset.

tools.name: get_animation_keyframes
tools.description: Gets the keyframe sequence (time points) for the specified animation. Useful for understanding the rhythm and timing.

tools.name: get_animated_widgets
tools.description: Gets a list of widgets that are affected by the specified animation.

tools.name: get_animation_full_data
tools.description: Gets the complete data for an animation, including all tracks and keys. Use with caution on large animations.

tools.name: get_widget_animation_data
tools.description: Gets the animation data specific to a single widget within an animation. Useful for fine-tuning a specific object's behavior.

tools.name: create_animation
tools.description: Creates a new animation in the current UMG asset.

tools.name: delete_animation
tools.description: Deletes an animation from the current UMG asset.

tools.name: set_property_keys
tools.description: Sets a sequence of keyframes for a specific property on the currently scoped widget.

tools.name: remove_property_track
tools.description: Removes the entire track for a specific property from the currently scoped widget.

tools.name: remove_keys
tools.description: Removes keyframes at specific times for a property on the currently scoped widget.

tools.name: refresh_asset_registry
tools.description: "I can't find the file!" - Forces Unreal to re-scan the disk for new assets.

tools.name: get_actors_in_level
tools.description: "What's in the scene?" - Gets a list of all actors in the current level.

tools.name: spawn_actor
tools.description: Spawns a basic actor (StaticMeshActor, PointLight, etc.) in the level.

tools.name: create_blueprint
tools.description: Creates a new Blueprint asset.

tools.name: compile_blueprint
tools.description: Compiles a Blueprint.

prompts.name: Analyze UMG Structure
prompts.description: Ask AI to analyze the current widget hierarchy.
prompts.content: Please inspect the current UMG widget tree using 'get_widget_tree'. Analyze the structure for performance bottlenecks, nesting depth, and naming conventions. Give a summary of what this UI likely does.

prompts.name: Generate Layout Code
prompts.description: Ask AI to generate Python layout code for the current UMG.
prompts.content: Please read the current UMG state and generate a Python script using 'create_widget' and 'set_widget_properties' that would recreate this exact structure. Organize the code into a function.
